alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 2:52PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Houghton and Baraga Counties. .Excessive rainfall of two to three inches combined with increased runoff will lead to additional rises in the Sturgeon River. Upstream releases will enable the river to remain above the Minor Flood Stage through much of the week. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sturgeon River near Chassell. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, The river begins to overflow onto Sturgeon River Road...Rajala Road...and Aho Road * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EDT Monday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday afternoon at 300 PM EDT.
